lines.content: [E][ ] | tsou teng yuan attend CS2113 lecture (from: Friday 20 Sep 4pm to: 6pm)

Cubone is a user-friendly command-line interface (CLI) program designed to help users manage their tasks efficiently. It provides essential task management features such as adding, marking, unmarking, deleting, and searching for tasks. Cubone aims to offer a simple yet powerful solution for tracking all types of to-dos, with support for deadlines and events. Whether you’re managing daily errands or significant projects, Cubone helps you stay organized and in control with intuitive commands and clear output formatting.
- Words in `< >` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `mark <index>`, `<index>` is a parameter which user should supply.
- Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as `help`, `list` and `exit`) will be ignored.
- The `<time>` parameters will be formated if possible
- The `<index>` parameter in `mark`, `unmark` and `deleter` should be provided as an interger and start by 1.
Shows a message explaning how to access the help page.
Shows a list of all tasks in the TaskList.
- The output will show the index, type, mark status, descriptions and time (if available) of the tasks.
- In the first quotation mark shows the type of the task.
- If non, means it is a simple task without a type.
- In the second quotation mark shows the mark status of the task.
- `X` means the task was marked as done.
- If empty, means the task was marked as undone.
2.    [X] | John Doe need to make dinner
5. [E][ ] | tsou teng yuan attend CS2113 lecture (from: Friday 20 Sep 4pm to: 6pm)
Adds a simple Task to the TaskList.
- `task John Doe need to make dinner`
Adds a Todo to the TaskList.
- `todo John Doe need to make dinner`
Adds a Deadline to the TaskList.
Description and time details must be added.
- `deadline John Doe need to make dinner /by 1800`
Adds an Event to the TaskList.
Description and time (from and to) details must be added.
Index of the task must be provided.
Do use the command [`list`](#listing-all-tasks-list) to check the index of task.
Index of the task must be provided.
Do use the command [`list`](#listing-all-tasks-list) to check the index of task.
Deletes a task from the list.
Index of the task must be provided.
> After deletion, the index of subsequent tasks will change. Please keep this in mind when executing this command consecutively.
> Do use the command [`list`](#listing-all-tasks-list) to check the index of task.
Finds tasks that contain the keyword in its `<description>`.
- The search is case-sensitive. e.g `Job` will not match `job`
- The search only perform in `<description>`, not in - `<time>`
e.g. keyword `1300` will not match the task `[D][X] | gym (by: 1300-1400)`
- The task's index in the TaskList will also be provided to - perform `mark`, `unmark` or `delete`.
* Represents a command to exit the program.
* The command word for this command is "bye".

*

When executed, this command returns a message indicating that the program is exiting.

*

This command can be checked if it is an exit command using the {@link #isExit(Command)} method.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Exits the program.\n"
* Executes the ByeCommand which signals the end of the program.
"Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"
* Checks if the given command is an instance of ByeCommand.
* @return true if the command is an instance of ByeCommand, false otherwise.
return command instanceof ByeCommand; // instanceof returns false if it is null
* Represents a command that can be executed.
* Each command operates on a TasksList and returns a CommandResult.
* Executes the command and returns the result.
* @return a CommandResult object containing the result of the command execution.
* Supplies the data the command will operate on.
* Represents the result of a command execution.
* Creates a new CommandResult with the specified feedback.
* @param feedback The feedback message to be shown to the user.
* Retrieves the feedback message from the CommandResult.
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* The command word for this action is "deadline".

*

Upon successful execution, the new deadline task will be added to the task list,
* and a success message will be returned.

*
  • COMMAND_WORD: The command word for adding a deadline.

*
  • MESSAGE_USAGE: The usage message for the deadline command.

*
  • MESSAGE_SUCCESS: The success message template for adding a deadline.

*
  • {@code DeadlineCommand(String description, String by)}: Creates a new DeadlineCommand with the specified description and time.

*
  • {@code execute()}: Executes the command to add the deadline task to the task list and returns the result of the execution.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Adds a deadline to the list. "
+ "Description and time detail must be added. "
+ "The time would be formatted if possible.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "New deadline added: %1$s";
* Executes the DeadlineCommand by adding a new task to the tasks list.
* Prints a confirmation message and the total number of tasks in the list.
* @return CommandResult indicating the success or failure of the command execution.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this Deadline:\n" + tasksList.get(tasksList.size() - 1).toString());
System.out.println("now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list");
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* The command requires the index of the task to be deleted.

*

Upon successful execution, the command removes the task at the specified index
* from the task list and returns a success message. If the task cannot be deleted,

*
  • {@code COMMAND_WORD} - The command word for deletion ("delete").

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_USAGE} - The usage message for the delete command.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_SUCCESS} - The success message format for the delete command.

*
  • {@code toDelete} - The index of the task to be deleted.

*
  • {@code DeleteCommand(int index)} - Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • {@code execute()} - Executes the delete command, removing the task from the task list and returning the result.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Deletes a task from the list. "
+ "Index of the task must be provided. Do check the list of tasks to get the index.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Task deleted: %1$s";
* Executes the delete command which removes a task from the task list.
* @return CommandResult indicating the success or failure of the command execution.
*         On success, it returns a message indicating the task has been removed and the
*         current number of tasks in the list. On failure, it returns an error message.
System.out.println("Got it. I've removed this task:\n" + deletedTask.toString());
System.out.println("now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list");
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command to add an event to the task list.
* The event includes a description and time details (from and to).

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_USAGE} - The usage message for this command.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_SUCCESS} - The success message for this command.

*
  • {@code toAdd} - The event to be added to the task list.

*
  • {@code EventCommand(String description, String from, String to)} - Constructs an EventCommand with the specified description and time details.

*
  • {@code execute()} - Executes the command to add the event to the task list and returns the result of the command execution.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Adds a event to the list. "
+ "Description and time details (from and to) must be added. "
+ "The time would be formatted if possible.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "New event added: %1$s";
public EventCommand(String description, String from, String to) {

System.out.println("Got it. I've added this Event:\n" + tasksList.get(tasksList.size() - 1).toString());
System.out.println("now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list");
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Finds tasks that contain the keyword. "
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n";
return new CommandResult("keyword: "+ this.toFind + "\n" + MESSAGE_SUCCESS + String.join("\n", foundedTaskText));

* Represents a command to display help information for the program.
* The HelpCommand provides a list of available commands and their usage instructions.
* This command can be executed to guide users on how to use the program effectively.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Shows program usage instructions.\n"
* Executes the HelpCommand and returns a CommandResult containing the list of available commands and their usage.
* @return CommandResult containing the list of commands and their usage.
* Represents an incorrect command that provides feedback to the user.
* This class extends the {@code Command} class and is used to handle
* situations where the user's input does not match any known commands.
* Represents a command to list all tasks.
* The command word for this command is "list".
* list: Shows all tasks in the list.

*

Upon execution, this command returns a CommandResult containing a message
* with all tasks in the list formatted as a numbered list.
* Here are the tasks in your list:
* @return CommandResult containing the success message with the list of tasks.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Shows all tasks in the list.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Here are the tasks in your list:\n";
* Executes the list command which formats and lists all tasks in the task list.
* @return CommandResult containing a success message and the formatted list of tasks.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* The command requires the index of the task to be marked.

*
  • {@code COMMAND_WORD} - The command word to trigger this command ("mark").

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_USAGE} - The usage message for this command.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_SUCCESS} - The success message template for this command.

*
  • {@code toMark} - The index of the task to be marked as done.

*
  • {@code MarkCommand(int index)} - Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • {@code execute()} - Executes the command to mark the task as done and returns the result.

*
  • {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} - If the provided index is out of bounds of the task list.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Marks a task as done. "
+ "Index of the task must be provided. Do check the list of tasks to get the index.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Task marked: %1$s";
* Executes the MarkCommand which marks a task as done in the tasks list.
* @return CommandResult indicating the outcome of the execution.
*         If the task is successfully marked as done, a success message is returned.
*         If an IndexOutOfBoundsException occurs, an error message is returned.
return new CommandResult("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + tasksList.get(this.toMark).toString());
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* The command word for this action is "task".

*

Upon execution, this command adds a new task with the specified description to the task list

*

If an error occurs during the execution, an error message is returned.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Adds a task to the list. "
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "New task added: %1$s";
* Executes the task command by adding a task to the task list.
* Prints confirmation messages to the console and returns a CommandResult.
* @return CommandResult indicating the success or failure of the command execution.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this Task:\n" + tasksList.get(tasksList.size() - 1).toString());
System.out.println("now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list");
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command to add a Todo task.
* This command adds a new Todo task to the task list.

*
  • {@code COMMAND_WORD} - The command word to trigger this command ("todo").

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_USAGE} - The usage message for this command.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_SUCCESS} - The success message template for this command.

*
  • {@code toAdd} - The Todo task to be added.

*
  • {@code TodoCommand(String description)} - Constructs a new TodoCommand with the specified description.

*
  • {@code execute()} - Executes the command to add the Todo task to the task list and returns the result.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Adds a todo to the list. "
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "New todo added: %1$s";
* Executes the todo command which adds a new task to the task list.
* @return CommandResult indicating the success or failure of the command execution.
*         On success, it returns a message indicating the task has been added.
*         On failure, it returns an error message.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this Todo:\n" + tasksList.get(tasksList.size() - 1).toString());
System.out.println("now you have " + tasksList.size() + " tasks in the list");
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
* Represents a command to mark a task as undone.
* The command requires the index of the task to be provided.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_USAGE} - The usage message for the command.

*
  • {@code MESSAGE_SUCCESS} - The success message template for the command.

*
  • {@code toUnmark} - The index of the task to be marked as undone.

*
  • {@code UnmarkCommand(int index)} - Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.

*
  • {@code execute()} - Executes the command to mark the task as undone and returns the result.

*
  • {@code IndexOutOfBoundsException} - If the provided index is out of bounds of the task list.
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD + ": Marks a task as undone. "
+ "Index of the task must be provided. Do check the list of tasks to get the index.\n"
public static final String MESSAGE_SUCCESS = "Task unmarked: %1$s";
* Executes the unmark command which marks a task as undone in the task list.
* @return CommandResult containing the result message of the unmark operation.
*         If the task is successfully marked as undone, the message will indicate success.
*         If an IndexOutOfBoundsException occurs, the message will contain the error details.
return new CommandResult("Nice! I've marked this task as undone:\n" + tasksList.get(this.toUnmark).toString());
return new CommandResult("An error occurred: " + e.getMessage());

* It initializes the UI, displays the welcome message, and enters a loop
* to process user commands until the exit command is received.

* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.

* The TasksList class represents a list of tasks.
* It provides methods to add, remove, and retrieve tasks from the list.
* The list is implemented as a static ArrayList of Task objects.
* Creates an empty list of Tasks.
* Sets the list of tasks to the specified list.
* @param TaskList the list of tasks to set
* Adds a person to the address book.

* The {@code Messages} class contains static final strings used for displaying
* various messages and UI elements in the application.

*
  • {@link #LOGO} - The ASCII art logo of the application.

*
  • {@link #CHAT_PREFIX} - The prefix used for chat messages.

*
  • {@link #CHAT_BAR} - A separator bar used in the chat UI.

*
  • {@link #MESSAGE_GOODBYE} - The message displayed when the user exits the application.

*
  • {@link #MESSAGE_INVALID_COMMAND_FORMAT} - The message displayed when the user enters an invalid command format.
public static final String MESSAGE_GOODBYE = "Good bye!";
public static final String MESSAGE_INVALID_COMMAND_FORMAT = "Invalid command format! \n%1$s";
* The Ui class handles interactions with the user.
* It reads user input, processes it, and displays messages to the user.
* It also provides methods to show welcome messages and command results.

*
  • Reading user input while ignoring comments and empty lines

*
  • {@code COMMENT_LINE_FORMAT_REGEX}: Regular expression to identify comment lines

*
  • {@code Ui()}: Default constructor using System.in and System.out

*
  • {@code Ui(InputStream in, PrintStream out)}: Constructor with custom input and output streams

*
  • {@code boolean shouldIgnore(String rawInputLine)}: Checks if a line should be ignored

*
  • {@code boolean isCommentLine(String rawInputLine)}: Checks if a line is a comment

*
  • {@code void showToUser(String... message)}: Displays messages to the user

*
  • {@code String getUserCommand()}: Prompts and reads user command

*
  • {@code void showResultToUser(CommandResult result)}: Displays command execution result

*
  • {@code void showWelcomeMsg(boolean LogFileRead, ArrayList inputed_tasks)}: Displays welcome message

*
  • {@code void showLine(boolean prefix)}: Displays a line with optional prefix
/** Format of a comment input line. Comment lines are silently consumed when reading user input. */
* Constructs a new Ui object with default input and output streams.
* This constructor initializes the Ui with System.in as the input stream
* and System.out as the output stream.
* Constructs a new Ui object with the specified input and output streams.
* @param in  the input stream to read from
* @param out the output stream to write to
* Returns true if the user input line should be ignored.
* Input should be ignored if it is parsed as a comment, is only whitespace, or is empty.
* @param rawInputLine full raw user input line.
* @return true if the entire user input line should be ignored.
* Returns true if the user input line is a comment line.
* @param rawInputLine full raw user input line.
* @return true if input line is a comment.
* Prompts for the command and reads the text entered by the user.

* Echos the command back to the user.
* @return command (full line) entered by the user

* The welcome message includes the Cubone logo and a chat bar.

System.out.println("I have read " + inputed_tasks.size() + " tasks from the Log file");
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");

* Displays a line with the default prefix.

* The Storage class provides methods to read and write tasks to a log file.
* The log file is stored in the data directory and is named Cubone.txt.
* The log file is read and written in the format specified in the user guide.
* Retrieves the log file. If the log file does not exist, it creates the file
* and its parent directories if necessary.
* Updates the log file with the given list of tasks.
* @param inputed_tasks An ArrayList of Task objects to be written to the log file.
*                      Each task will be written on a new line.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
// run through the list of tasks and write them to the file
* Reads the log file and parses the tasks stored in it.
* The log file is expected to contain tasks in a specific format.
* Each line in the log file represents a task and is split into task details.
* The task details are parsed based on the type of task (Todo, Deadline, Event, or generic Task).
* @return An ArrayList of Task objects parsed from the log file.
*         If an error occurs while reading the file, an empty ArrayList is returned.
// the task is a task (without a prefix character)
Event newEvent = new Event(eventDescription, eventFrom, eventTo);
System.out.println("Error reading the log file, invalid data detected.");
